thread.title: India to host first Pro Fight Night in November
thread.title_full: India to host first Pro Fight Night in November - The Times of India

author: Tushar Dutt
title: India to host first Pro Fight Night in November
text:
PUNE: The Indian Boxing Council (IBC) will conduct their first Pro Fight Night in end of November or early December said Brigadier Muralidharan Raja (retd) on Wednesday. 

Raja, who earlier served the Indian Amateur Boxing Association as its president, has been getting enquiry calls from across the country since IBC's first licenced boxer Vijender Singh won his debut fight against Briton Sonny Whiting in Manchester last week. 

"We are planning to conduct the first Fight Night somewhere in the end of November or December first week," Raja told TOI. "We are planning to open registrations for the boxers, promoters and trainers after 10 days. Once we get the applications, we will shortlist the best candidates for the fight. 

"We are also looking to include foreign boxers in the fight." 

Raja, who was also the acting Chef de Mission for the London Olympics, also said that the IBC has recently concluded a workshop for their first batch of Pro technical officials. 

"We have certified 13 officials as referees, judges and ring side doctors. As we have the technical team ready, we now have to shortlist the boxers and trainers before the Fight Night," Raja added. 

The 13 officials were given their 'IBC Technical Official Badges' during a 3-day clinic cum certification examination, held in Pune. They were certified as 2 Star and 1 Star grades based on a stringent criteria which involved testing their practical and theoretical knowledge as well as submission of their credentials from their previous Amateur Boxing experience. 

The IBC, formed by Raja, is a non-profit organisation that helps Indian amateur boxers in turning professional. Olympic medallist Vijender Singh is IBC's first licensed boxer. Stay updated on the go with Times of India News App. Click here to download it for your device.
